intro: Chamaeclema, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lobed or divided, and small, yellow or white flowers arranged in racemes. Chamaeclema species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions. They are also known for their hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh weather conditions.
